metadata.Title: CVE-2018-17937 on Ubuntu 21.04 (hirsute) - medium.
metadata.Description: gpsd versions 2.90 to 3.17 and microjson versions 1.0 to 1.3, an open source project, allow a stack-based buffer overflow, which may allow remote attackers to execute arbitrary code on embedded platforms via traffic on Port 2947/TCP or crafted JSON inputs.

criterions.comment: gpsd package in hirsute, is related to the CVE in some way and has been fixed (note: '3.17-6').
